thread.title: Shelley Leibowitz, Former Morgan Stanley and World Bank CIO, Joins Endgame Board of Directors

author: cnbc.com
title: Shelley Leibowitz, Former Morgan Stanley and World Bank CIO, Joins Endgame Board of Directors
text:
ARLINGTON, Va., March 8, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Endgame , the leader in endpoint protection against targeted attacks, today announced that Shelley Leibowitz is joining the Endgame Board of Directors. Shelley has an outstanding track record leading and advising companies on technology strategy, IT portfolio and risk management, and cybersecurity governance, and has served on the Endgame Advisory Board since 2013.
"Shelley, drawing on her extensive experience as a technology leader in financial services, has a remarkable ability to see security from the perspective of senior management teams and boards of directors," said Nate Fick, CEO of Endgame. "Her broad experience with corporate governance and building high-performing teams will be a tremendous asset as Endgame continues to accelerate its market expansion."
Currently, Leibowitz serves on the Board of Directors of E*Trade Financial Corporation, where she sits on the Risk Oversight and Governance Committees. She also serves on the Board of Directors of AllianceBernstein Holding LP, where she sits on the Audit Committee. In 2016, Leibowitz launched SL Advisory, providing tailored advice and insights to senior executives and Boards of Directors in technology strategy, IT portfolio and risk management, and cybersecurity governance. She is also a member of the National Association of Corporate Directors, where she is a frequent speaker and has achieved the NACD CERT Certificate in Cybersecurity Oversight for Board Directors.
In 2009, Leibowitz was appointed to be the World Bank's first Group-wide Chief Information Officer. In her role, she was responsible for the technology services and capabilities that underlie the work of delivering quality knowledge and financing products to World Bank clients across the globe. Leibowitz also oversaw the World Bank's Library and Archives, managed the Bank's comprehensive cybersecurity program, and served as a member of the Pension Investment Committee.
"Endgame's unparalleled understanding of the attacker, combined with its industry-leading ability to detect never-before-seen attacks addresses a substantial gap left by today's enterprise security solutions," said Shelley Leibowitz. "I'm thrilled to deepen my role with Endgame, and to continue to help support this innovative team in its position as a leader in security solutions."
About Endgame:
Endgame's endpoint protection platform brings certainty to security with the most powerful scope of protections and simplest user experience, ensuring analysts of any skill level can stop targeted attacks before information theft. Endgame unifies prevention, detection, and threat hunting to stop known and unknown attacker behaviors at scale with a single agent.
